titleStmt.title: Reasons against agreement with a late printed paper, intituled Foundations of freedome, or, The agreement of the people whereby it doth appear that the particulars proposed in the said paper are not foundations of freedom but of tyranny and slavery to the people, being destructive to religion, laws, liberty, and government against our Covenant and Protestantism, and very dangerous and unsafe for the kingdome / by William Ashhurst.
titleStmt.author: Ashhurst, William, 1617-1680.

titleStmt.title: Reasons against agreement with a late printed paper, intituled Foundations of freedome, or, The agreement of the people whereby it doth appear that the particulars proposed in the said paper are not foundations of freedom but of tyranny and slavery to the people, being destructive to religion, laws, liberty, and government against our Covenant and Protestantism, and very dangerous and unsafe for the kingdome / by William Ashhurst.
titleStmt.author: Ashhurst, William, 1617-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Reprinted at the charge of Sir Francis Nethersole Kinght [sic],

notesStmt.note: Originally printed for Thomas Underhill in 1648.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
